website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic DMP-BDT220 is the best Blu-ray value of 2012, with built-in Wi-Fi, tons of streaming-media apps, 3D compatibility, and a simple user interface.
pros: The Panasonic DMP-BDT220 has built-in Wi-Fi, 3D compatibility, and the Viera Connect suite of streaming-media services, which includes Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant, Pandora, and Vudu
The user interface for the streaming-media apps is straightforward, plus you can jump right to Netflix with the dedicated Netflix button on the remote
There are a few other minor perks, including Skype compatibility, a front-panel SD card slot, and a superfast quick-start mode
cons: Viera Connect doesn't support any subscription music services (like MOG, Rdio, or Spotify) nor does it have Flixster for UltraViolet support
The DMP-BDT220 also doesn't play back DivX or Xvid files

customer_reviews.title: Keeps saying DVDs are incompatible even though I know they're fine.
customer_reviews.text: I had the same problem someone else reported. Had the player for 7 months and it started reporting that DVDs were incompatible. I tested it on some of my older DVDs and they had the same problem. I unplugged the unit and replugged it in (rebooted it), and it then played my older DVD fine. But 1 hour later and it wouldn't play it again. So the reader mechanism isn't reliable. I checked for the latest firmware update and I have the latest. I don't like giving bad reviews, but this one deserved it. If it was just me, I'd say it's a one off. But I saw someone else had the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good player, only one output (HDMI)
customer_reviews.text: So far it seems like a good solid player. The product description didn’t specify what type of outputs on the back but I have always had good luck with Panasonic so for $99 I took a chance. Was disappointed to find only one HDMI output and nothing else. Ran the player’s HDMI output to my TV and the TV sound output to my receiver. Hopefully this will give me surround sound. Otherwise this player will be banished to the bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and connected it easily to wifi. I played a DVD and it kept freezing every minute or so- very irritating. I thought the DVD was scratched or bad. When I connected to Netflix, I noticed the same thing happened. After trying other DVD's, unplugging and reconnecting the disc player, I concluded the DVD is faulty. Amazon will not give me a refund as over a month had passed, the seller is telling me to contact Amazon, and Panasonic doesn't care. Maybe it is a lemon, maybe Panasonic is junk. I just know that I have to buy a new DVD player and I am out $90.
customer_reviews.author: Treena C

customer_reviews.title: Will not read DVDs, skips, stutters, just a bad design electronically
customer_reviews.text: This player stopped working after about a year-and-a-half, it was unresponsive to the remote, and the player kept telling me that my DVDs were unreadable even though they were brand new from Amazon. I switched it out with another DVD player and my DVDs worked so basically, and according to many of the other reviews, I'm having the same problems, it's a non-functioning defective unit and goes all wonky in short time. I don't recommend buying this unit whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Dawne Belloise

customer_reviews.title: Bought because of 3D and twin HDMI. HDMI will ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought because of 3D and twin HDMI. HDMI will not send video to HDMI splitter so if you have a setup with HDMI to 3D Projector and another HDMI to receiver that's not HDMI compatible you'll get a blue screen. My older Panasonic Blu Ray player DMP-BDT500P handled this perfectly. This one is going back.
customer_reviews.author: tech guy

customer_reviews.title: Product problems.
customer_reviews.text: The dvd player stops in mid-movie and has to be re-started and advanced to finish a movie. I bought this in December. Support cannot help me and it's too late to return product. Avoid this model.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Augustine

customer_reviews.title: AC adaptoe cable shown on parts list was not included.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the size of this DVD player = smaller than my old one. However, the AC adapter cable was NOT included so I couldn't install it. Returned it and received a replacement the next day. The second one didn't include the AC adaptor cable either so I tried to use the cable from my old DVD player (also a Panasonic) but that didn't work. So I returned that one, too.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley Sifers

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Set-Up
customer_reviews.text: It took me less than a half hour to take this Panasonic player out of the box, go through the quick setup process, get the Wi-Fi connection established, and the firmware updated. No problems. It plays the AVCHD format video recorded by my HD camera beautifully. I have had two Panasonic Blu-Ray players prior to this one, so I am very familiar with the easy-to-use Panasonic menu screen.
customer_reviews.author: cyclone47

customer_reviews.title: flawed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit because it was low priced and small in size. However it has some serious flaws. When you first turn it on you must wait about 45 seconds for it to boot before you can do anything, like opening the tray. Also I have never been able to get the closed captioning to work with regular DVDs or Blu ray discs. I am currently shopping for another player.
customer_reviews.author: lylelwr

customer_reviews.title: Very good and plays AVCHD disks flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: As usual, the user manual and on-screen set up instructions could be better especially if your network router doesn't have a physical WAP button and indicator light to connect the wifi. The online tutorial (listed in the document packed with the machine) helped me get the wifi connected. The player makes some unusual noises when the disk is loading but is silent while playing the disk. Important for me is that fact it plays AVCHD format disks flawlessly. The legends for the seldom-used buttons on the top should be on the front where they can be seen. A minor gripe. My previous players didn't. Very compact. A real bargain. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Prager

customer_reviews.title: Solid, fast. No DVD copyright playback issues.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected, a bit bigger than my Roku 4 but not by much. We bought this because we were having copyright problems with our Sony player. The Sony refused to play legal DVD's on and off. With each Sony firmware update the problem worsened. We had heard the Panasonic brand didn't have that problem. This turned out to be true. Goodbye Sony. This Panasonic unit works great. I suggest when the player requests to update the firmware (this seems to be an automatic process), don't do it. If you are happy with the way it works for you, then why mess with the firmware? Solid player. Hard to go wrong here.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Arnopp

customer_reviews.title: great 3 d
customer_reviews.text: easy to use 3 d is really good, there is no amazon app they show it in their advertisement but its not available ,not a deal breaker have that app on T.V. anyway so far so good bought this over others for the 2 HDMI ports and Panasonic for their 3 D you can change the image a little add more 3 d effect ,shipped on time returned an L.G. for this one it is a 4k upscale you can not play 4k DVD
customer_reviews.author: oldschool;53

customer_reviews.title: Not for DLNA
customer_reviews.text: This may be a great little BD player. But the key reason why I got this was to play videos on my DLNA capable NAS. Turns out that this model can only do that if you have a Miracast capable phone/tablet that can broker the connection between NAS and the BD player. I tried a few apps on my iPhone that are supposed to do that. They found the NAS but never the Pana. This unit will go back tomorrow. Sad, really.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebus

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I particularly like the smart features, but they are a bit cumbersome to use and quite slow. But it has MLB TV, netflix, and You Tube which I wouldn't be able to play on the TV in my bedroom where this Blu-Ray player lives otherwise. I like that very much. I also like that the picture quality and aspect ratio is tweakable, which really helped when I had a not so great TV in the bedroom. I have a better one there now and I don't have to tweak anything. The panasonic has a great picture quality. I just wish it streamed faster.
customer_reviews.author: Modern FossilTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: It plays all that I have!!!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY!!! I found a DVD player that plays everything format that I have/need. I've tried a lot of different brands of players and none of them would play a "data disc" with mp4, mkv, and other computer type video formats. This one DOES. It only has HDMI output. I wish it had the old RCA jacks (composite) but it doesn't. What I thought was odd, it doesn't have an Ethernet port BUT it does have wireless Internet connectivity. So if you don't have a wireless router, forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. N. Broadrick

customer_reviews.title: Love.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this about 5 months ago. I'm not sure why it has such an average rating because I absolutely love it. It plays 3D blu-rays, but I cannot comment on that aspect because I do not own a 3D television. I mostly bought it because of the wi-fi capabilities and the ability to access Amazon On Demand. I am a Prime member so I have enjoyed having access to various television shows and movies. This blu-ray player also has access to various other apps like Youtube, Netflix, and Hulu--although I cannot comment on the performance of them. I'd say for the average movie watcher, who might not be so tech savvy, this is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-Ray for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like Panasonic Blu-rays; I have tried Sony and Samsung but keep on coming back to Panasonic. It loads quickly and plays everything I have. Some say the interface is 'dated', but I find it easy to navigate, and the remote is intuitive. The USB port is for external playback and not memory, but unless you actually use the BD Live features (I don't know anyone who does), who cares. It has wireless if you need it, Ethernet if you don't. If and/or when I get a 4K TV, I'll see how the upscaling is, but the video is good on my Panny plasma, and it decodes everything.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Ward

customer_reviews.title: as always Panasonic puts out a good product again
customer_reviews.text: good unit beautiful picture only problem is my sony surround sound does not play through amp system but sends it to my tv. I bought a unit a couple of years ago that let's you plug 5 hdmi cables and sends it to one input on tv. using this unit, it separates the audio into cable or fiber optic cable on amp and then it works correctly with only one hdmi cable to tv and the sound is played through the surround sound amp.
customer_reviews.author: R. George

customer_reviews.title: Very nice DVD player
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research and discounted Sony and Samsung. This works like a charm. The only issue is I use IR extenders to mount inside a cabinet. To load/eject a DVD the front panel folds down so it hides the IR transmitter and once it stayed down after inserting a disc and the IR receiver couldn't see the remote command. Nice menu set-up with tons of features.
customer_reviews.author: D. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Lockups galore, slow menu recognition, great picture when it worked
customer_reviews.text: This blue-ray player keeps kicking me out of Netflix randomly, requires frequent re-sign-in, and has issues transitioning from blue ray disc player back to streaming Netflix. Required multiple times daily to be unplugged and rebooted in order to normalize again (a 10 minute process). It was too frustrating so I had to return it. Another negative is the slow to respond remote and menu commands. On the plus side it was excellent when it worked and I really enjoyed the picture quality. But I'd rather watch in standard def than deal with the frequent hanging up of this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Griffis

customer_reviews.title: Having a 3D projector and good amplifier that could not pass 3D
customer_reviews.text: I needed this specifically for the two HDMI output ports. Having a 3D projector and good amplifier that could not pass 3D, this was a good route to go in order to pass audio to the amp and 3D to the projector. Saved me near term on buying a new amp though I imagine eventually as I upgrade for ATMOS I'll give in and buy a better amp. In the mean time, I'm happy that Panasonic provides a two output BR player.
customer_reviews.author: bbobg

customer_reviews.title: works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Only 4 stars because I bought one of these from Panasonic about 2 years ago. It broke already. Not abused by any means. and not even used very much. Maybe played only 100 times or so. That hurts my faith in Panasonic. This new Panasonic DMP-BDT220 with Integrated Wi-Fi is good. Setup was pretty easy, even for impatient me. Play quality of BluRay discs is great as you'd expect. Quality of WI-Fi Netflix reception is great. Wireless router is on the other side of a 4000sqft house and the reception quality shows 4 bars! Integrates perfectly with our Panasonic G25 Plasma TV, which has fantastic picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Pairs nicely with my old-school Panasonic plasma
customer_reviews.text: Freezes occasionally, but mostly works well. Pairs nicely with my old-school Panasonic plasma.
customer_reviews.author: ADHD Coach Boston

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sent me a Australia/New Zealand Unit
customer_reviews.text: I have been battling this thing thinking I was doing something wrong since I purchased it. No Amazon App or NetFlix, could't play certain DVDs even though they were region 1. Going through the set-up menu for the internet I discovered I was sent a non US model DVD player. Panasonic never responded to me and I will never buy another one of thier products. They must know about this and are not backing thier product. I bought it to use with my Prime membership but I might as well cancel that and just get Roku and Netflix. I can't even bring myself to pawn this off on someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Monstar

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable player
customer_reviews.text: When it works it is a very fine player. Quality is great. However it is a very cranky unit that just shuts itself off periodically resulting in the need to unplug it to get it to work again. This is my 3rd blueray player and by far the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: great idea, theoretically
customer_reviews.text: This should be an awesome machine, and in fact it does work well as a player. Mine is not doing so well as a 'smart' streaming device, however. The interface is terribly clunky; the buttons on the remote are poorly laid out, too crowded, and frequently don't function; and sometimes the whole thing simply freezes up, goes black, and needs to be unplugged to restart. Maybe we just got a lemon, but I'm going to try to buy my old Sony back from Goodwill tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Poor streaming, fine for DVDs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mostly for streaming purposes but it's pretty poor on that front. The player constantly reboots kicking you back to the start menu for the player I'm also constantly having issues with it freezing during streaming videos, forcing me to exit completely and try to restart the video, usually with no luck. User interface and menus are also less than great. All in all, not worth the money if you're hoping to stream; only really useful as strictly a DVD player. UPDATE 3/18/2013: After the latest firmware update, the problem has only gotten worse. Streaming on netflix, amazon instant and hulu is unusable. I'm downgrading to 1 star since I purchased this solely for the streaming.
customer_reviews.author: AMW

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up and use. Picture on it is great. I've only played one blue ray disc on it so far but it worked fine. I like how you can turn off your blue ray movie and come back to the same place on it later. Only problem I've had is that Netflix doesn't want to load up on it. But that's not why I bought it so it's not a big deal for me. I'm glad I went with this brand instead of Sony or Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: While I can still recommend Panasonic in general
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. In less than two days I had a number of problems with the player and with streaming. It locked up twice, once when trying to play back a Blu-Ray disk, and once when trying to navigate the screwy menu system to stream Netflix. Both lockups required I unplug the device and plug it back in again. I've never had a problem with Panasonic devices before this; most of my experience comes from the camera (micro four thirds) side of their house, but I've also had some older audio-video products. While I can still recommend Panasonic in general, I can't recommend this line of players.
customer_reviews.author: W. H. Beebe Jr.

customer_reviews.title: poor performance
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Sony BDP-S590, but when I saw the glowing review from c-net on this Panasonic I cancelled my order and bought this Panasonic instead. What a mistake! I thought I could live with the ocassional skipping and freezing on both blu-ray and DVD discs. But when I streamed video from Amazon (through a wired high-speed connection, up-to-date firmware) it would freeze for a split second almost every time there was a scene change in the movie. I wasn't sure it was the player so I ordered the Sony. What a difference! The Sony performs flawlessly. Panasonic needs to improve their product.
customer_reviews.author: Danny P

customer_reviews.title: Avoid it like the plague. Flashy, pretty, dies within months.
customer_reviews.text: First one we purchased crapped out in less than a month. Returned it and purchased the same model on the assumption that it was a defective unit...no such luck. It’s now less than three months out and it is already malfunctioning. Unless you enjoy throwing your money away, don’t buy Panasonic products.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Berger

customer_reviews.title: Parents Love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Dad on his birthday to use primarily for Netflix. He has always used cable/satelite and is new to the world of video streaming. Needless to say he is hooked. He has not used cable since. Have not used this as a Blu Ray player yet, but as a Netflix streamer it rivals my PS3. Loading screens are fast, picture is crisp and clear. The "Netflix" button on the remote is a great feature. Especially for old people who can barely turn the tv on. Overall, It works great, couldnt be happier. This is a fantastic product, you will not be disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great player for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Easy to use -Brilliant picture -Netflix app with dedicated button on the remote -Panasonic app market -VIERA Connect if you have other Panasonic devices -Wireless capabilities Cons: -DLNA leaves a lot to be desired on file types it will play -Netflix app is great, but wish it had more categories like Apple TV Unknown: -3D capabilities, I don't have 3D TV Summary: This is a great blu ray player, especially if you have other Panasonic devices - they work very well together. I love the netflix app and the dedicated button on the remote, but was disappointed with the DLNA capabilities. Great buy for the internet video watcher and blu-ray watcher!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Haas

customer_reviews.title: When compared to a PS3, it wins and loses.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based upon a c|net review I watched to replace my PS3. Well, don't trust c|net. It works, but has some annoying drawbacks. PROS This player seems to have a clearer streaming picture than a PS3. Has more streaming apps than a PS3. Moving from app to app is much easier than a PS3 Player is very slim. CONS This player's navigation response time is staggeringly slow. The player will reboot out of the blue for no apparent reason. Must use the player's remote to control the player and the remote will only control certain Panasonic TVs. I will keep the player, but I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: justin c seibold

customer_reviews.title: Issues...Issues
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. The firmware or whatever they call it was defective on two of the devices I was sent and I was unable to set up to connect to my wifi. Admittedly, tech support was very helpful, but they're not available at night and on the weekends. Without explaination, the device occasionally begins to act up and I have to do a hard restart (I learned the secret button sequence from one of my many conversations with tech support). Picture quality is excellent, Device is slow to connect to wifi and slow to respond to button pushes. I bought this machine b/c of the positive reviews it received. Infortunately, I have not had a positive experience.
customer_reviews.author: mvcrez

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive player. Better than a smart TV.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over three years. The NetFlix app is dated. Everything else works really well. Pros: Good video Reasonable startup times Vierra Cast apps for Netflix, Skype, and Amazon Video work well Compatible with HDMI+CEC as implemented by Samsung despite Samsung's devices claiming otherwise Cons: Netflix and Pandora apps haven't aged as well as the other apps The volume control on the remote is not programmable. You must have a Panasonic TV to use it. Notes: We have not used the 3D features. You'll have to hunt to find the skype camera for sale online, but it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Use it only for Blu-rays; use the smart tv for most other viewing. Love how easy it is to use; so far haven't been able to figure out how to easily get to the chapter selection. Careful when unpacking; the front plastic that flips down to reveal disc slot is very easily scratched, even with a cleaning cloth. Had no issues when using, although did need to buy another HDMI cable to connect everything. Now if someone can tell me what button to hit to get to chapter selection when viewing a blu-ray!
customer_reviews.author: Harper Rue Tivoli

customer_reviews.title: Blu-ray player works fine, but wireless streaming is hit-or-miss
customer_reviews.text: Compared with our old blu-ray player, this one boots up and responds much more quickly when playing disks, and it hasn't had any issues with smudged disks. But for streaming, this has some real problems. Every time we turned it on, it had lost its wireless connection, and we had to go through the whole connection drill again, entering password, etc. Panasonic tech support advised that we switch to a wired connection, which is rather ridiculous given that this is advertised for its wireless capability. Nonetheless, that's what we ended up doing. This required shelling out another $60 for a powerline adapter, to run our internet through the house wiring. That solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All I got was a four page instruction manual that is the worst I have ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Where are the instructions? All I got was a four page instruction manual that is the worst I have ever seen. No where does it say anything about being 3D. and how to use it? Nor does it tell you very much at all. Come on Panasonic You are better than this. If I had just looked at the unit and the instruction (so called ) manual I would not have known that this was a 3D Blu-Ray machine.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T. Houtz

customer_reviews.title: Overheating
customer_reviews.text: Since my purchase, the right side of the blu-ray player becomes so hot to the touch, it could burn you. The TV screen freezes and I’m forced to remove the power cord and restart after it cools down. Major disappointment. I’ve even manipulated how the player sits, so there is air flow available to the right side.
customer_reviews.author: R.L.. Lathe

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine! Cheap, too!
customer_reviews.text: I have this hard wired to my network with a cat-5 cable (Mediabridge 100') so I can't judge the wi-fi capability. I walked through the menu choices at setup and got the firmware update right away. Logged in to Netflix with no hassles. I admit that punching in my Netflix user name and password took a bit of dexterity with my big thumb on the remote since I kept hitting the "home" button instead of "up" and then I lost everything I typed in but after three trys and two more beers I finally got it. Smoothe sailing ever since. Blu-rays look beautiful on the Panasonic 42" plasma, too.
customer_reviews.author: GMPullman

customer_reviews.title: Good DVD Player, Lousy at Streaming
customer_reviews.text: WIFI gets tired and can’t maintain the stream. Frequent buffering and complaints about not enough bandwidth. To fix you have to unplug it and let it sit about 30 seconds. Then it may perform properly. Or not. I often switched to a DVD. On a whim I bought a Roku and plugged it into the HDMI3 (Game) port so we could use the DVD player in HDMI2.. Its performance so far is flawless. Also has the benefit of a SIMPLE remote that’s easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, won best Blu-Ray player the year it came out and continues to impress. I purchased used. It has broad range of features, easy WiFi hookup, loads your discs quickly with great playback. Makes your standard DVD's look great. This machine deserves its quality reputation. I used one at work, so I was familiar with this player. When looking at new Blu-ray players I couldn't get past all of the bad reviews. For me, even a few years old this machine is just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: George W.

customer_reviews.title: I bought it because the reviews I read looked good versus others at the same price
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work well from the beginning. The disc player seem to get hot and crash. It would not turn off or on or anything until I unplugged it and let it sit until it cooled down. I bought it because the reviews I read looked good versus others at the same price. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I never would have believed a simple consumer device could be so difficult to reprogram, update, or troubleshoot. mandatory firmware updates are extremely slow (20 mbps down), each one introduces new glitches that didn't exist before. Now that the unit is reaching the end of the warranty, it freezes up on BD play, won't respond to any controls, has to be unplugged for several minutes. BD quality is good, but SD is mediocre, not even the match of my old $40 Toshiba SD player. I advise others to read the detailed 2 and 3 star reviews on this site before purchase, I wish I had, instead of relying on CNET's advice.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chilson

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Panasonic Player!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Panasonic electronics for over 30 years, because they never fail to give terrific and lasting performance. I bought this Blu-ray player as a gift, because I bought a similar model in 2014 which operates beautifully. I know Panasonic is phasing out some of its electronics and concentrating in other areas, which is such a shame!
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Freezes Up
customer_reviews.text: Not a big fan of this product. I'm not a fan of its menu set up and navigation, however, I can get by those things. The main problem is it freezes up. It particularly does it during shows that have been watched before, and the only way to unfreeze it is to unplug it. It gets really annoying. To the point we ended up putting it away and using our old Blu-Ray which doesn't allow us to watch our Amazon shows.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S.

customer_reviews.title: Return of Panasonic DMP-BDT22
customer_reviews.text: Worst Panasonic item we have ever purchased! BlueRay wouldn't stream fully, making us trying to start events over. Still did not work! Tried even to unplug WiFi, Modem and BlueRay & reestablish.......but still not working up to standards. On hearing that the Samsung BDE-5700 had similiar problems, we got the latest-greatest Samsung BDF-5900 and it is exactly right-on. This has soured us on Panasonic and has taught us to read reviews but......not the advertiser's ones...... only the purchaser's reviews. Our appreciation for Amazon.Com's return policy. You made the return of a piece of junk easy and painless. Thank you for your Return Policy! We will continue to purchase from Amazon.Com. ......But very carefully! "Old Wing"
customer_reviews.author: VIRAGO JIM

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: This Panasonic DVD player fired right up with no connection issues. The picture quality is very good and the inclusion of actual operations buttons on the unit, instead of just on the remote, is very welcome. Unfortunately, a significant drawback is the lack of an optical output port for audio (to a receiver or amp).
customer_reviews.author: Mark M., South Hadley, MA

customer_reviews.title: controls aren't as intuitive as other brands, sometimes seems ...
customer_reviews.text: controls aren't as intuitive as other brands, sometimes seems slow to select in its menu and I had an issue with it having some damage (the case around the machine had popped out during shipping) and the seller BLINQ told me that I was on my own. I fixed the case and dealt with it but even in working condition its not my go to choice in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Red

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: We have problems with pixelation quite often. Maybe I'll try a cleaner but I'm not sure that's the problem. The controller is limited in function and it conflicts with my other controllers. Kind of a pain. The flip cover broke off after a year.
customer_reviews.author: cat

customer_reviews.title: Fine for steaming Amazon, lousy for Netflix
customer_reviews.text: I bought this DVD strictly for the fact that it is supposed to work great with Netflix, it does not! I have no problem streaming Amazon Prime movies, but every single movie I've tried to play using Netflix always comes up with the problem that they having trouble playing the title right now, it doesn't just happen once it happens at least two three time during a less than 2 hour movie. From what I've read on the net Panasonic players in the past have had problems playing Netflix streaming video. Also this thing loads dvd disks and everything else very slowly. Wish I had bought a different player, this is the last time I ever purchase anything by Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I had taken back a couple Sony BDP-BX18 bluray players - absolute junk. On every level. Order a couple of the Panasonic BDT110 players to replace. Wow. Maybe it's just because I came off the Sony experience, but I am thoroughly impressed with the value and function of the Panasonics. The menu system is so much more pleasant and intuitive. I bought this primarily for streaming Amazon Instant Prime and HuluPlus. Both of which set-up and function as they should. Again - the Sony menu system is crap. As is their registration BS. Strongly recommend this over any Sony (most have the exact same menu system regardless of model). Had everything setup in 5 minutes. Hopefully it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Cartman

customer_reviews.title: Forget ROKU! Love Viera Cast!
customer_reviews.text: The movie quality is awesome... don't get me wrong, but it's secondary. Panasonic makes a Viera Cast bluray that has built in Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon prime, Pandora, etc. We cancelled our cable. For $15 a month we have Hulu Plus & Netflix. If you don't know Hulu Plus.. check it out. I think it's over 150 cable & international stations and all their programming. Thousands of shows and their own Hulu shows which are great. A ROKU was the same as the Viera Cast Bluray and it has Bluray! No brainer! Note: We bought Viera cast for ourselves & mom a regular bluray. I'm not sure which one this is so check them out.
customer_reviews.author: J&J

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMP-BDT220 Blu-Ray DVD player
customer_reviews.text: This is a good Blu-Ray player at a good price. Panasonic has been an excellent brand for me over many years. I have an older Panasonic Blu-Ray player that is still doing well, but I can't update its firmware. Panasonic's old method of downloading the update to a DVD with your computer, and then playing it in your Blu-Ray player just never worked for me. But that player without a firmware update still serves well. The DMP-BDT220 player is easy to update and I have done that. It also serves me well, but actually no better than the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory S

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I got this from Amazon used, and am pleased with it so far. I don't have the patience for wifi connection, and this has the option for a cable link to my modem. Besides HDMI output, it also has yellow-white-red connection, which I haven't tried yet. The blu-ray player works well, but I got it mainly for use with Netflix. The reception is very good, but navigation is a little slow and sluggish; not too serious, though. It is the same size as my other equipment (17" wide by about 1 1/2" thick.)
customer_reviews.author: Harmon McCraw

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I've truthfully never before bought a product that exceeded every expectation I had for it. I just use it to watch cds and stream Netflix wirelessly and I could not be more pleased. Hooking up to Netflix was simple matter ( although I did have to push one button on the remote once), if I have one complaint it would be the instruction manual. Why don't some of these manufacturers hire someone who has English as a native language to write their manuals? Luckily the necessary operations of the unit are self-explanatory. In short I love it, it's a bargain, and I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: MIKEY

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years of Flawless Performance
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Blu-Ray player for just over three years now and it has been flawless. I am not very gentle with my equipment, so I would say this player is extra durable also. 4 stars is now my highest rating unless something goes above and beyond. This player does everything it's supposed to do and it does it without any headaches. If your looking for a 3d blu-ray player and you can find one of these at a reasonable price then grab it and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Device stopped playing discs after only 5 months of moderate (1-3 movies a week) use. Smart Features still work, remote is too easy to accidentally hit netflix button when wanting to use arrow up, Picture is what I expected for a blu-ray.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I found everything about the interface very intuitive and (thankfully)very easy to set up with our complicated stystem. The only issue I would have is that Netflix tends to cut off in the middle of viewing and you have to turn the machine off and on again to get back to the program you were watching. I haven't experienced that with the Amazon movies. I love that all my favorite things are already there. I do wish that there was a key board (maybe on the back side of the remote) so you when you sign up for something via the player, you don't have to do it "old school texing" style. Overall I am very pleased with this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Kriskris

customer_reviews.title: It was good
customer_reviews.text: After a year, started acting up. Freezing, saying blu ray discs are incompatible, having to unplug to get started again. Has been replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Tas

customer_reviews.title: Easy for an 80 yr old to setup
customer_reviews.text: My 80 year old father had no trouble hooking this up and playing his 3 Blurays and even ordered Netflix. That right there sums up how easy and user friendly this player is. I had bought him an LG last year ( which I have 3 of and thought they were the greatest) but it was too difficult for him to setup. I then bought him a Memorex brand thinking how simple can you get? Well quality was the issue with that one. Didn't work so often he put it in his closet. The Panasonic is quiet, fast boot up and smooth playing I bought him another one for his bedroom for Xmas and a few more Blurays.
customer_reviews.author: Woody1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Blu-ray player.
customer_reviews.text: This BD played was purchased as a backup to my current older Sony. I have not checked all the features yet, but it provides excellent performance. Update: The player usually will not immediately power off when you press the power button. It temporarily goes off, then the unit comes on and switches the TV on. You have to press the power switch 2 or three times before finally going off. Panasonic support was clueless and took me through the setup process which did nothing so they recommended repair. Too much trouble at $99 so I'll try different HDMI TV connections.
customer_reviews.author: JBGood

customer_reviews.title: There is no support for regular HD disks or regular photos on conversion to 3d like my Sony did
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged for shipment. Somewhat misleading in that it only convert s Blurey 2D disks to 3d. There is no support for regular HD disks or regular photos on conversion to 3d like my Sony did ,which I lost in a divorce. Wish I had bought the Sony, so sad. I have not had a chance to actually view how it does on my 3D disks. I have a Panasonic 3D TV so I am expecting it to work well. Also I have yet to hook it up to the internet. The TV is already hooked up so only reason for me to hook up is to get firmware updates
customer_reviews.author: RICK

customer_reviews.title: Viewing at its best.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this player to upgrade from my basic Panasonic model so I could take advantage of the Skype capability while maintaining my 3D movie capability. I have found the playback on the player to be exceptional. Because it matches with my HDTVs ability to do 24 frames per second I am getting a very pleasing and cinema like playback in my home. Plus with the use of my Panasonic camera for Skype I am able to enjoy having great video conferences with my children and their families spread across the country. I recommend this player to any and all; especially those who benefit even more by paring this up with a Panasonic HDTV.
customer_reviews.author: jessmull

customer_reviews.title: Fine with Blu-Ray, but does very poorly with DVD disks.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, easy to use. Streams nicely, too. The remote is actually designed with a pretty good user interface -- very rare in remotes! HOWEVER: it does a really poor job playing DVDs. I have DVDs that play fine on my computer, on DVD players, and on an older Blu-Ray player. But the Panasonic doesn't get the aspect ratio right and has a weird grainy appearance. So I originally gave it 5 stars but my old DVDs are important, so it gets my demotion.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Coffin

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Blu Ray player with great features
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this player to utilize its WiFi and Netflix capability in a location where I don't have a hard wired LAN connection and the TV doesn't have internet capability. It is similar to a non-WiFi Panasonic Blu Ray player I've had for a couple years in another room. It works well and the onscreen menus are more refined than the older unit. The only drawback I've found is that it takes a minute or so to connect to the router after you turn it on. If you go straight to Netflix you get a connection error until it completes connecting. Overall a good value. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: FrankA

customer_reviews.title: Best Blu-Ray player we've owned
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these units to upgrade an older Panasonic and Toshiba Blu-Ray that did not have Wi-Fi built in. Easy set up, initiated the firmware updates immediately upon internet connection, and both have performed well. Some of the menu functions are odd (for lack of a better description), stellar video quality on every disc tried to date. Only issue is it's extreme light weight; easily slides back when operating buttons to load/eject, but solved that with some stick on silicone feet over the original pads.
customer_reviews.author: corky

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu-ray player!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what the negatives reviews are all about? You really have to take some of these reviews with a grain of salt! This BR player is very nice. It has a small footprint, very thin, which I like. Set-up was a breeze. The network features are flawless. Connected easily. Streams movies beautifully. Loading time to play a BR disc is fast. The remote is not too cluttered with buttons. Does everything you need and is easy to use. Picture quality is perfect. Couldn't be happier. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Shea

customer_reviews.title: Won't play Fox BluRays; others work OK
customer_reviews.text: Good machine, BUT Fox BluRays are unplayable (Life of Pi, etc.). Perhaps because Panasonic won't provide the firmware updates, but also because Fox is being so stupid about their copy-protection folderol. So I'm not wasting money on Fox movies any more.
customer_reviews.author: JoJesty

customer_reviews.title: Very short lifespan......
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of use, the player generated an extremely loud buzzing sound while operating. It was so loud that you couldn't listen to the movie being played. Amazon's return period was expired, and Panasonic's customer support was a nightmare. I ended up getting another blu ray player. I have two Panasonic plasma tv's and love them. I have another, older Panasonic 3D blu ray player that I love. This one didn't perform like the rest of my Panasonic devices.
customer_reviews.author: cjscho

customer_reviews.title: Got this for WiFi before a new Smart TV!
customer_reviews.text: Panasonic made a great product, though a new TV might make some features redundant. Even so, its probable cheaper than upgrading to the "next best" model LED. When the home network is acting up, it makes a great alternate Amazon Prime or Flux viewer. Purchased this with the Panasonic USB camera to enable Skype from the Big Screen. A little too slow to recommend for using with YouTube, but your mileage may vary. Great, great picture if like me you don't want 3D. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Brady Brown

customer_reviews.title: Have had close to a yr now...
customer_reviews.text: before i bought i reviewed all these reviews and I was a little hesitant, but figured i'd go ahead and buy it. It has been nothing but great. We use it to stream mostly but also play some blu-ray and DVDs and have never had one iota of issue. periodically it prompts us to update the firmware and this may also help to keep things working right. Only complaint is that Netflix is "integrated" in the remote control... really wish they had done some of this integration with Amazon Prime streaming service instead.....
customer_reviews.author: Pop ina Bottle

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Adequate
customer_reviews.text: This blu-ray player delivers a wonderful picture on my "Panny" plasma. For the price, you would be hard-pressed to find a comparable blu-ray player which offers 3D functionality. One note: If you purchase this now, you will likely have to upgrade the firmware (a few minutes or less to download on a broadband connection) to the newest edition. My wife and I tried to watch a blu-ray the other day and found that we had to update it before it would work. Once we did, though, it performed superbly. Your player must be connected to the internet to update the firmware and it is easy. I hope you enjoy this player as much as we do.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bilsky

customer_reviews.title: Works very poorly and missing one desired feature.
customer_reviews.text: It does not have one key feature we have come to expect in a Blu-ray player. Other players remember where you left of on a disc, but this one does not. Otherwise, it works well. After using for less than a year, we have decided to replace this unit. It frequently skips in the middle of Blu-ray discs. The discs have no apparent scratches or damage of any sort, but it still struggles to play an entire disc without problems. It seems to play DVDs much better.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon&Jill

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed.
customer_reviews.text: It is great for streaming Netflix. The Blue Ray Player works well with regular and Blue Ray disks. The hook up to my receiver with HDMI cables is nice and I use the ethernet cable for network connection. Never cuts out. I think that getting back to the Apps is a bit clunky. But the remote is good and the Netflix shortcut button on the remote does the trick. Very pleased. Have not used the 3D function but that is only because I don't have a 3D TV not sure ever will. There was not another buying option. I think all the reviews on Amazon or CNet did the trick for me.
customer_reviews.author: DallasArlington

customer_reviews.title: Not worth a penny
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this junk zero stars, I'd do it. The setup went ok but the moment I turned it off, it would no longer connect to the internet and dvds didn't play in it. Please don't waste your money on this thing. Go with something other than Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: vauro

customer_reviews.title: What a Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Walmart DVD player special that cost $29 over 5 years ago. The set up was long but easy and it makes your television a smart television by either wireless wi-fi or by connecting to your computer. It plays all the regular DVD's as well as Blue-ray and 3D Blu-Ray. I now can get Vudo as well as Pandora and Netflick. My only complaint was the carrier decided I didn't live in the town that I live in and took it on a 4 day journey that didn't need to happen but I eventually got it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Dias

customer_reviews.title: Wish they hadn't retired the format
customer_reviews.text: I had my previous 3d Panasonic player for nearly 9 yrs. When it was beginning to get glitchy, I got a few more months out of it after trying a lens cleaner. I was so relieved to see this 2015 model still in the box--- otherwise my rather expansive 3d BD collection would go unbidden. This was a great find, and the picture quality is even better than w/ my old player. I should be good for another 10 yrs., I hope.
customer_reviews.author: No longer 1 and 1/2 D

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Blu Ray player and after several months of ownership I can safely say that it simply does not reliably play Blu Ray discs. Even brand new, clean discs will suddenly have the audio skip and lag as many as 3-4 times in a 2 hour movie. I'll end up pausing and rewinding till it re-syncs. As I've become used to sitting back and relaxing while watching movies on my past DVD players (even cheap third hand ones) its terribly frustrating to pay well over triple digits for a Mid-level player that can't perform it's main function. The next time I drop some dough on a mid-tier player it's gonna be a Sony or Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a couple reasons. It was one of the best rated 3D players. It has Amazon Video. What I found out, it has a great easy to use remote as well as a downloadable app to control it with an Android phone. It loads Blu Rays fairly quickly and video performance is very good. I would recommend to buy again. Update April 2013 - after buying an Onkyo receiver I downloaded the Onkyo app for my Kindle and this app sees and controls this DVD player as well. A nice unexpected feature.
customer_reviews.author: JJP

customer_reviews.title: Great player for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace an aging Samsung. That player just had more and more trouble playing newer disks. This unit loads quickly. Has played almost flawlessly, thought i've seen some . I don't hand any need or use for all the Apps so that is not a selling point. I don't have Netflix either, so I can't comment on that. I have opted to use an Ethernet connection rather than WiFi. It just fast for all things, especially streaming (if I wanted to). Quick load. Reliable play. 3D for when I get a 3D TV, you can't beat the price. I would recommend it yes.
customer_reviews.author: fezzik

customer_reviews.title: Not one complaint.  Great Blue Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: Never a hick-up with this Blue Ray from Panasonic. Read a number of reviews about how well people liked it, so I purchased one and have been using it on a regular bases. My only issue is not with the player, but with the Blue Ray movies themselves. Have to click on a number of buttons to get to the darn movie, and pass over Pre-views of other movies out or coming out. I just want to get to the movie right off, but have not found a way. Not the players fault but wanted to pass this one to those that buy a blue ray for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Shuts itself off in the middle of a movie and must be unplugged and replugged to power back on. Gets stuck on Netflix or Hulu screen and freezes and must be unplugged. Even Panasonic knows it's crap so much so they gave it only a 90 day warranty. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: disarmwithasmile

customer_reviews.title: Initial review of a good Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this 3D Blu-ray player to go with a recently purchased 3D Samsung 51" plasma TV. With both it is a learning experience. I haven't played a true 3D Blu-ray yet. I have used the 3D upconvert feature with a DVD that produced some 3D scenes but most were not. One limitation is that when in 3D mode, the audio is limited to the TV speakers or the optical output. Regular Blu-ray discs produce excellent video presentation and sound. I have connected it with an ethernet cable to a router and used it to update the firmware but little else yet. I would probably rate higher if I had used more of its features.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Shankel

customer_reviews.title: updated and works awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: updated review. This piece of crap freezes on a regular basis and just shuts off. It was great for about a week and then boom all the problems started. I hate this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Stax

customer_reviews.title: Good bluray but slow streaming
customer_reviews.text: good blu ray player. the streaming options are fairly exhaustive - Netflix, amazon, youtube and others are easily accessible. However, deduct 1.5-2 stars for the fact that there is some lag in the streaming programs and I bought this particular model because of the "smart" components. The processing power seems a bit slow. Netflix requires 30 seconds to boot up and moving from one program to another requires some patience. Occasionally the system crashes. Firmware update related usually. Overall I am thinking a roku or apple tv is better for streaming. the bluray component gets a higher rating.
customer_reviews.author: I. Meth

customer_reviews.title: Really Happy With This Product
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this product since March 11, 2013. I gave the Panasonic DVD player 4 stars because I'm not very technically inclined and can't comment on the technical aspects. However, everything else about this player is wonderful. The HD color is gorgeous and it plays great through my sound system. Set-up was a breeze, Panasonic walks you through all of the set-up. We have been streaming movies via Amazon prime, but you can get many other movie, games and shopping channels such as Net Flix, Hulu etc. Have nothing negative to say about this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Parbus

customer_reviews.title: Few bugs, but decent product overall
customer_reviews.text: This is on the cheap end of Wireless Blu-rays, so I wasn't expecting electronic awesomeness, and I got what I was expecting. This is a basic, functional Blu-ray player that was easy to set up and operate. We don't have cable - just watch Hulu, Netflix, etc - and the Blu-ray seems to be much slower in accessing these things than either my Wii or my Roku. Also, it occasionally just resets itself for no apparent reason, even if you're not touching the remote. But for $200, it's great. If you can't stand a few annoyances, pay more and get a better player.
customer_reviews.author: WendyKat

customer_reviews.title: good little blueray streamer does an awesome job with my ...
customer_reviews.text: good little blueray streamer does an awesome job with my 55 inch plasma Panasonic actually has a better pic on dvds than the Samsung surround I replaced with this and the remote runs the tv too so were down to one remote from three lol
customer_reviews.author: Herman Keller

customer_reviews.title: Nice complete wifi Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after some research, as I wanted a wifi ready player that I could use with ALL the pay per view services I use. Many other brands will inexplicably leave Amazon out but this one has Amazon, netflix, and vudu. Setup was straightforward, entry of login info was well though out with QWERTY keyboards that made the process simple in comparison to other players I've set up. Wifi linked up without any trouble. Haven't actually played a disc on it yet but picture quality for streaming services has been fine without pixelation or other issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: I had to upgrade to a 3D player when I purchased a VIERA TC-L47ET5 TV. This player is easy to use, works well, and 3D DVDs are stunning. But it also does an excellent job with regular DVDs. It seems to upgrade their quality - not all the way to Blu=Ray, but they seem better than what I see on my older Panasonic Blu-ray DVD player (non-3D). I bought it primarily to match my Panasonic TV (it may not be so, but I feel same brand products should integrate seamlessly), and I am very pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Software kinda sucks!  Price sucks now too!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and the Panasonic camera for it. It works fine, but the software interface is clunky and not a finished feel to it. The remote has buttons in bad locations where if you bump the next button nearby it takes you back to the beginning, and you have to run through all the menus aver again. Otherwise, picture quality is good. Price was $179 shipped for both the camera and the player, and now they've blown the prices out of the ocean! Just checked and they're charging $323 shipped for both now? That's pretty nutso increase!
customer_reviews.author: Senator Al Green

customer_reviews.title: RCA audio outs are a plus.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected. RCA audio outs are hard to find in newer players. This alone was my hope. Worked very well with my old school hi end stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Gill

customer_reviews.title: seems got a good deal
customer_reviews.text: got this one to replace my Bluray player (which stopped working) of my integrated home theater : "Panasonic SC-BT300 1250W 7.1 Channel Blu-ray Disc Home Theater Sound System"  It works great with my TV/Home theater (all Panasonic). I don't have 3D TV so do not know about 3D function. Interestingly, the price today is $224, while I got it at $126 in 5/2011. Probably 3D player is in more demand now. I probably got a good deal if I will ever get a 3D TV :)
customer_reviews.author: Sheng Sun

customer_reviews.title: DVD Player for Skyping
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Panasonic Blu-ray DVD player with the intent of using it for Skyping on our large screen TV. The many functions it offers relative to viera is great. The only problem is that for Skyping, you must use Panasonic's webcam which can cost up to $299. However, I did purchase two for $129 each at BB. I am still working out the Skyping which works, but not with the clarity I expected. But that was with the Panasonic HD webcam and another non-HD webcam which is being replaced with a Panasonic HD. According to trouble shooting via the internet, you should use two HD webcams.
customer_reviews.author: E. Eshleman

customer_reviews.title: Great for older hook up system that use RCA and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for older hook up system that use RCA and VGA cords. My outdated projector had no HDMI or coaxial video. This is one of the few WiFi blue ray players that support the old school. Worth over penny.
customer_reviews.author: Benefit of the doubt

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but problems from the start. Constantly having to unplug and restart. Finally quit.
customer_reviews.author: Lady di$

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PLAYER
customer_reviews.text: I JUST WROTE A VERY BAD REVIEW ABOUT THIS PLAYER. I HAD A BLACK RECTANGLE BLOCKING THE SCREEN WHEN I TRIED TO VIEW A DVD. I HAD READ SO MANY OF BAD EXPERIENCES THAT OTHERS HAD HAD WITH PANASONIC HELP THAT I HAD NOT CALLED THEM. BUT I DECIDED THAT I WOULD SEE IF THEY COULD HELP ME SOLVE THE PROBLEM WHICH HAD JUST SUDDENLY ARISEN. PANASONIC HELP NOT ONLY TOLD ME HOW TO FIX THE PROBLEM BUT ALSO WERE VERY NICE AND POLITE. ALL I HAD TO DO WAS TO CUT OFF THE CLOSED CAPTIONING ON THE TV. I JUST WANTED TO REMOVE MY BAD REVIEW AND SAY SOMETHING POSITIVE ABOUT PANASONIC.
customer_reviews.author: RAINDROP

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I recommend just saving your money and building/buying an HTPC. It's a great bluray player, one of the best. My biggest issues with a bluray player vs a HTPC, is that the Netflix app loads SO SLOWLY; and if I use an HTPC, then I don't have to pay to watch Hulu on my tv. The menus are kind of clunky. It sometimes will randomly shut off, but that may have been due to overheating from leaving it on for too long.
customer_reviews.author: nicreis

product_meta.title: Panasonic DMP-BDT220 Integrated Wi-Fi 3D Blu-ray DVD Player
product_meta.description:
Style:Prior Generation 2










Panasonic’s 2012 Blu-ray Disc players focus on smart home networking, high-quality picture and sound, ease-of-use, eco-efficiency, and sleek design. The BDT-220 is a Full HD 3D Blu-ray Disc player that features expanded VIERA Connect functionality, FLAC (Free Lossless Audio Codec) compatibility, and superior sound image and quality.

VIERA CONNECT IPTV -- MORE FUN COMES VIA A CLOUD SERVICE

Panasonic’s IPTV platform VIERA Connect, now under the Smart VIERA umbrella, has been expanded for 2012 Blu-ray products and now utilizes cloud technology to present an unlimited number of entertainment, social networking, gaming, health & fitness, sports & news sites. Learn more about the world of Smart VIERA and VIERA Connect here. 


Enhance your Blu-ray Experience with Popular Apps
Enjoy sites such as Skype, Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, You Tube, huluplus, CinemaNow, Vudu, Pandora, Facebook, Twitter, My space, and Flixster. With 2012 models, you have access to a wide variety of Internet content from the comfort of your living room.

Clicker - Video on Demand Cross Searching
Find your favorite movies and video content easily with one-step searching, which allows you to cross search from multiple VOD services. For ease-of-use, use the quick keyword input on VIERA Connect to help retrieve your desired content faster. Customize your screen by grouping commonly used apps and displaying them on the screen for easier use.

Communicate with Family and Friends
The social networking TV app allows you to access social network sites and communicate with your loved ones while simultaneously watching TV. Watch live sports games while upping the excitement by chatting with your friends as the game unfolds. Record an original message and set it as your answering voice message. Callers can record messages onto an SD Card (min. 512MB required), while you are away. *Skype camera not included with TV purchase

FULL HD 3D BLU-RAY DISC PLAYBACK
The advanced 2D technologies of the Panasonic Hollywood Laboratory have also been applied to 3D image playback, providing high quality images. 2D-3D conversion enables conversion of 2D images on DVDs and Blu-ray Discs into 3D images with natural depth perception. Screen type (flat or round) and frame color are easily selectable. Watch your favorite DVD movie collection in 3D for even greater viewing enjoyment. 
24P OUTPUT FOR VOD
The BDT-220 not only plays Blu-ray Discs and DVDs, but also video-on-demand movies content in the same 24p format as used at movie theaters. Connection to a 24p capable TV via an HDMI capable lets you enjoy a wide array of content with full cinematic picture quality. This feature requires a TV that supports 24p playback.*

UNIPHIER CHIP PROCESSOR
This Full HD 3D Blu-ray Disc player features UniPhier single chip signal processing that eliminates unnecessary wiring, resulting in reducing noise on the picture and sound signal to the absolute minimum. The DVD Super Resolution Processor helps produce natural pictures with no false contours, higher resolution for details, and a reduction in noise.

CONNECTIVITY
The entire 2012 line features DLNA for easy connection to other DLNA equipped products. Share and enjoy digital photos (JPEG), music (MP3, WMA) and videos (AVCHD, WMV) by simply connecting to a home network (LAN). VIERA Link provides connectivity to other VIERA Link compatible products and NAS compatibility. The BDT-220 has a Wi-Fi system built right into the main unit so you can enjoy VIERA Connect and BD-Live content without having to connect with a LAN cable or wireless LAN adaptor. Players are also compatible with the NTFS format HDD.

ADAPTIVE CHROMA PROCESSING
Adaptive Chroma Processing is a high quality image-processing technology developed to precisely process each pixel of Blu-ray Disc video signals in the vertical and horizontal directions to produce extremely high color resolution and beautiful edges.

PERSONALIZATION
To personalize the home theater experience, the new multi-user mode on the BDT-220 allows you to register four users and each can record individual favorite settings. You can select a personal icon from 16 pre-installed images, or photos from an external source. You also have the option to customize the home screen with any image you choose. Features like the home screen customization as well as enhancement of VIERA Connect allow you to easily personalize your entertainment experience to fit your lifestyle. Download the exclusive Panasonic app and you’ll also be able to use your iPhone or Android smartphone as a remote control for your BDT-220.


ENERGY STAR QUALIFIED
Panasonic is always working to improve its technology, design, and commitment to the environment. Attractive compact designs and energy-saving functions help Panasonic Blu-ray Disc products protect the environment by effectively conserving limited natural resources. All 2012 models are Energy Star Qualified.
